docs.snippet: The current advance of industrialization in Brazil has been "handicapped, not helped," by wartime conditions, George E. Quisenberry, secretary of the Overseas Automotive Club, who has just returned from a 16,000-mile three-month tour of Latin...
docs.lead_paragraph: The current advance of industrialization in Brazil has been "handicapped, not helped," by wartime conditions, George E. Quisenberry, secretary of the Overseas Automotive Club, who has just returned from a 16,000-mile three-month tour of Latin America, declared yesterday.

headline.main: SAYS WAR HELD UP INDUSTRY IN BRAZIL; ' Trick Devices' Used in Latin America Also Are Assailed by Quisenberry TRACED TO REICH, BRITAIN Trade Prospects Held Bright -- Reveals Postal Restrictions Have Been Lifted by U.S. SAYS WAR.HELD UP INDUSTRY IN BRAZIL

docs.snippet: Brazil is planning an intensive campaign to promote the sale of mate in this market, it was disclosed here yesterday by Dr. Generoso Ponce Filho, a director of the Mate Institute of Brazil, who has just arrived here for the purpose of arranging...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil is planning an intensive campaign to promote the sale of mate in this market, it was disclosed here yesterday by Dr. Generoso Ponce Filho, a director of the Mate Institute of Brazil, who has just arrived here for the purpose of arranging details of the campaign.

headline.main: BRAZIL PLANS DRIVE ON MATE EXPORTS; Institute Representative Now Here to Work Out Campaign for Expanding Market

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 25 (AP) -- The Inter-American Committee for Political Defense published today the text of a message sent to the Foreign Secretaries of all American republics having declared war on or broken relations with the Axis.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 25 (AP) -- The Inter-American Committee for Political Defense published today the text of a message sent to the Foreign Secretaries of all American republics having declared war on or broken relations with the Axis.

headline.main: AMERICAS ARE WARNED ON NEW GOVERNMENTS; Regimes 'Constituted by Force' Are Cited as Dangerous
